rationale: No intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifies a risk-adjective.
The segment reports cases and spread factually ('only two people... have tested positive', 'spreading among cows') without high-potency framing.
Neutral language used; 'tested positive' is factual reporting.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
This segment reports a fact (number of cases) and lacks explicit calming language.
